info.title: Databricks Tags API (workspace)
info.description: OpenAPI specification for the Databricks tags service (workspace-level APIs), generated from the Databricks Python SDK.

post.summary: Creates a new tag policy, making the associated tag key governed. For Terraform usage, see the [Tag
post.description:
Creates a new tag policy, making the associated tag key governed. For Terraform usage, see the [Tag
Policy Terraform documentation]. To manage permissions for tag policies, use the [Account Access
Control Proxy API].

[Account Access Control Proxy API]: https://docs.databricks.com/api/workspace/accountaccesscontrolproxy
[Tag Policy Terraform documentation]: https://registry.terraform.io/providers/databricks/databricks/latest/docs/resources/tag_policy

:param tag_policy: :class:`TagPolicy`

:returns: :class:`TagPolicy`

create_time.description: Timestamp when the tag policy was created

update_time.description: Timestamp when the tag policy was last updated

get.summary: Lists the tag policies for all governed tags in the account. For Terraform usage, see the [Tag Policy
get.description:
Lists the tag policies for all governed tags in the account. For Terraform usage, see the [Tag Policy
Terraform documentation]. To list granted permissions for tag policies, use the [Account Access
Control Proxy API].

[Account Access Control Proxy API]: https://docs.databricks.com/api/workspace/accountaccesscontrolproxy
[Tag Policy Terraform documentation]: https://registry.terraform.io/providers/databricks/databricks/latest/docs/data-sources/tag_policies

:param page_size: int (optional)
  The maximum number of results to return in this request. Fewer results may be returned than
  requested. If unspecified or set to 0, this defaults to 1000. The maximum value is 1000; values
  above 1000 will be coerced down to 1000.
:param page_token: str (optional)
  An optional page token received from a previous list tag policies call.

:returns: Iterator over :class:`TagPolicy`

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return in this request. Fewer results may be returned than requested. If unspecified or set to 0, this defaults to 1000. The maximum value is 1000; values above 1000 will be coerced down to 1000.

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: An optional page token received from a previous list tag policies call.

delete.summary: Deletes a tag policy by its associated governed tag's key, leaving that tag key ungoverned. For
delete.description:
Deletes a tag policy by its associated governed tag's key, leaving that tag key ungoverned. For
Terraform usage, see the [Tag Policy Terraform documentation].

[Tag Policy Terraform documentation]: https://registry.terraform.io/providers/databricks/databricks/latest/docs/resources/tag_policy

:param tag_key: str

get.summary: Gets a single tag policy by its associated governed tag's key. For Terraform usage, see the [Tag
get.description:
Gets a single tag policy by its associated governed tag's key. For Terraform usage, see the [Tag
Policy Terraform documentation]. To list granted permissions for tag policies, use the [Account Access
Control Proxy API].

[Account Access Control Proxy API]: https://docs.databricks.com/api/workspace/accountaccesscontrolproxy
[Tag Policy Terraform documentation]: https://registry.terraform.io/providers/databricks/databricks/latest/docs/data-sources/tag_policy

:param tag_key: str

:returns: :class:`TagPolicy`

patch.summary: Updates an existing tag policy for a single governed tag. For Terraform usage, see the [Tag Policy
patch.description:
Updates an existing tag policy for a single governed tag. For Terraform usage, see the [Tag Policy
Terraform documentation]. To manage permissions for tag policies, use the [Account Access Control
Proxy API].

[Account Access Control Proxy API]: https://docs.databricks.com/api/workspace/accountaccesscontrolproxy
[Tag Policy Terraform documentation]: https://registry.terraform.io/providers/databricks/databricks/latest/docs/resources/tag_policy

:param tag_key: str
:param tag_policy: :class:`TagPolicy`
:param update_mask: str
  The field mask must be a single string, with multiple fields separated by commas (no spaces). The
  field path is relative to the resource object, using a dot (`.`) to navigate sub-fields (e.g.,
  `author.given_name`). Specification of elements in sequence or map fields is not allowed, as only
  the entire collection field can be specified. Field names must exactly match the resource field
  names.

  A field mask of `*` indicates full replacement. It’s recommended to always explicitly list the
  fields being updated and avoid using `*` wildcards, as it can lead to unintended results if the API
  changes in the future.

:returns: :class:`TagPolicy`

parameters.name: update_mask
parameters.description: The field mask must be a single string, with multiple fields separated by commas (no spaces). The field path is relative to the resource object, using a dot (`.`) to navigate sub-fields (e.g., `author.given_name`). Specification of elements in sequence or map fields is not allowed, as only the entire collection field can be specified. Field names must exactly match the resource field names. A field mask of `*` indicates full replacement. It’s recommended to always explicitly list the fields being updated and avoid using `*` wildcards, as it can lead to unintended results if the API changes in the future.

create_time.description: Timestamp when the tag policy was created

update_time.description: Timestamp when the tag policy was last updated

entity_id.description: The identifier of the entity to which the tag is assigned

tag_key.description: The key of the tag. The characters , . : / - = and leading/trailing spaces are not allowed

delete.description:
Delete a tag assignment

:param entity_type: str
  The type of entity to which the tag is assigned. Allowed values are apps, dashboards, geniespaces
:param entity_id: str
  The identifier of the entity to which the tag is assigned
:param tag_key: str
  The key of the tag. The characters , . : / - = and leading/trailing spaces are not allowed

:param tag_key: str

:param tag_assignment: :class:`TagAssignment`
:param update_mask: str
  The field mask must be a single string, with multiple fields separated by commas (no spaces). The

  `author.given_name`). Specification of elements in sequence or map fields is not allowed, as only
  the entire collection field can be specified. Field names must exactly match the resource field
  names.

  A field mask of `*` indicates full replacement. It’s recommended to always explicitly list the
  fields being updated and avoid using `*` wildcards, as it can lead to unintended results if the API
  changes in the future.

:returns: :class:`TagAssignment`

get.summary: List the tag assignments for an entity
get.description:
List the tag assignments for an entity

:param entity_type: str
  The type of entity to which the tag is assigned. Allowed values are apps, dashboards, geniespaces
:param entity_id: str
  The identifier of the entity to which the tag is assigned
:param page_size: int (optional)
  Optional. Maximum number of tag assignments to return in a single page
:param page_token: str (optional)
  Pagination token to go to the next page of tag assignments. Requests first page if absent.

:returns: Iterator over :class:`TagAssignment`

parameters.name: entity_type
parameters.description: The type of entity to which the tag is assigned. Allowed values are apps, dashboards, geniespaces

parameters.name: entity_id
parameters.description: The identifier of the entity to which the tag is assigned

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Optional. Maximum number of tag assignments to return in a single page

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Pagination token to go to the next page of tag assignments. Requests first page if absent.

entity_id.description: The identifier of the entity to which the tag is assigned

tag_key.description: The key of the tag. The characters , . : / - = and leading/trailing spaces are not allowed

update_time.description: Timestamp when the tag policy was last updated
